column2: data variable type ref to class . create object variable «exporting parameter = argument».[1]
class variable«(parameters)»; or class *variable = new class«(parameters)»;
class «instance handle» { «properties/data members assignments, instance method overrides» }
class *variable = [[class alloc ] init]; or class *variable = [[class alloc ] initWithFoo:parameter «bar:parameter ...»];
create variable or create «{TYPE}» variable.make_foo «(parameters)» or variable := create {TYPE} or variable := create {TYPE}.make_foo «(parameters)»
let variable = new class «parameters» or let variable = object members end[4]

The class is an Object. Just send a message to a class, usually #new or #new:, and many others, for example: Point x: 10 y: 20.
Array with: -1 with: 3 with: 2.
var variable = new class«(parameters)» or var variable = { «key1: value1«, key2: value2 ...»»}

val obj = new Object // no parameters
val obj = new Object(arg0, arg1, arg2...)
val obj = Object(arg0, arg1, arg2...) // case class
val obj = new Object(arg0, arg1, param1 = value1, ...) // named parameters
INVOKE class "NEW" RETURNING variable or MOVE class::"NEW" TO variable

column8: pointer to object can be converted into an integer ID
object handle can be converted into an integer ID
pointer to object can be converted into an integer ID

column6: When x is COMPARABLE, one can simply do x < y
column7: When x is HASHABLE, one can use x.hash_code
column8: When x is IDENTIFIED, one can use x.object_id
